properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 8:55AM AKST until January 18 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts
north of Kodiak City. Winds gusting around 30 to 40 mph.
Visibility reduced to one-half mile in heavy snow and blowing
snow at times.

* WHERE...Kodiak Island.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 4 PM AKST Saturday. Heaviest snow intensity
in Kodiak City from 3 AM to 10 AM.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures are expected to warm into the
lower to mid 30s. Precipitation type is expected to remain
mostly snow though rain may briefly mix in near the coast.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel,
keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case
of an emergency.

For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit
511.alaska.gov.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM AKST SATURDAY
